metadata.title: CVE-2019-18805 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in net/ipv4/sysctl_net_ipv4.c in the Linux kernelbefore 5.0.11. There is a net/ipv4/tcp_input.c signed integer overflow intcp_ack_update_rtt() when userspace writes a very large integer to/proc/sys/net/ipv4/tcp_min_rtt_wlen, leading to a denial of service orpossibly unspecified other impact, aka CID-19fad20d15a6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-18805` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required
